website_summaries.verdict: This three-pocket cargo net seems to fit many pickups well, a challenge for other nets. If you end up needing a couple more inches, try bungee cords or carabiner clips.
pros: Measures 44 to 56 inches and 14 inches deep for smaller items
Adjusts to fit most trunks and rear cargo space
Pockets give you storage for smaller items
Holds groceries and emergency items well
Removes easily if you need trunk space for larger items
cons: Included sticky mounting hardware does not work well
Consider using 3M Scotch VHB Tape or drilling holes if your vehicle doesn't have pre-installed cargo hooks

customer_reviews.title: Worked great in a 2016 Subaru Outback.  Please note that I did have to drill holes and install the screws.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great in a 2016 Subaru Outback. Please note that I did have to drill holes and install the screws. In my vehicle I had to install the clips/hooks. Per the directions, I cleaned the car plastic with alcohol and then pressed the hooks in the locations that I wanted. The temperature was above 70 degrees and left it for 24 hours. The next day I hooked on the net to the hooks and one of the hooks popped off immediately. I certainly would not trust the adhesive backing only to hold anything. So, I then carefully drilled holes and installed the screws. It worked perfect and is very secure.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Fits 16 Focus ST perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This was a must have in the back of my Focus ST. This is my first hatchback, and I've quickly realized the need to keep everything in place! I grabbed this and tossed it in. It fits over the hooks that already exist in the car. It doesn't really lock onto the hooks, but I've yet to have an issue with it falling off. Not much else to say other than thanks for keeping my eggs from being scrambled sooner than I wanted!
customer_reviews.author: A. Jerman

customer_reviews.title: Good enough!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use in an Escalade. There are 2 posts already on the Escalade that I am able to hook a loop from each end of the net to. Though you really should have 4 attachment points, this is working fine for me. The pro is it's easy to get off if I want to move something large, but the con is the net isn't as securely attached. I haven't had any issues with it coming off, but we shall see. At any rate, it's been really nice to be able to put my groceries in this and they don't go rolling out of my car when I open the back.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie D

customer_reviews.title: Well made product
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say about cargo netting......this is well made and does exactly what I had in mind keeping "stuff" from flying around in my RV when I'm on the road. I've had it now close to a month and netting looks like new. I would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: FastEddy

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my 2013 Ford Focus ST. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2013 Ford Focus ST. Installation wasn't hard...I actually decided to drill the tabs into the interior so I didn't have to rely on the adhesive backing. While I wouldn't say my ST is fast, it does have a decent amount of torque and can take corners at decently high speed. I regularly keep the hatch decently full of things I need for work and I got tired of everything sliding around. So I bought this cargo net and I haven't had that problem since. It definitely was ~$17 very well spent,.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Jarensky

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! This was odd to mount in my '12 ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! This was odd to mount in my '12 Dodge Challenger, although the included adhesive "pucks" actually work very well. I was surprised to actually like the three "compartments/sections" rather than the typical single unit. This allows for much less sliding around of your items. The Challenger has a larger trunk, although no real place to "organize" anything and this gets the job done. If you're planning on putting larger items and don't need this unit, just unclip the bungee around the "puck" and put it back when you need it. Very nice for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Works great in my CR-V, use S hooks for the back loops.
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a solution to the plastic grocery bag dumping syndrome for some time now and even thought of inventing one myself. For a minimal investment, this three pocket storage net is exactly what I needed. It fits well in the storage compartment of my CR-V. Just connect the two front loops on the CR-V's existing hooks and use two S hooks found at your local hardware store to attach the rear loops to the seat back bracket. Voila! you will no longer have fruit rolling around as you drive home from the market.
customer_reviews.author: Greg From Oro Valley AZ

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, and that's what you get.
customer_reviews.text: Too narrow for my pickup truck. I needed someplace to put groceries so they didn't make a run for the front. The price is right, so I added bungee balls to the end loops. Unfortunately, one of the corner loops has already pulled out, so my bungee now goes around the fabric edge. The solution is a real divider, but not at $265 for the Toyota one. Maybe a piece of lumber.
customer_reviews.author: Allen S

customer_reviews.title: Great for my truck!
customer_reviews.text: Worked excellent in the bed of my truck. Groceries stay in place without sliding everywhere. I put it to the test with a gallon of milk, canned goods, and other heavy objects taking turns at high speed and sudden braking. I was blown away with how well this unit worked! I've a full-size and was worried about it stretching all the way across but there's enough bungee to reach and still have spring. You may need to install the mounts, or drill holes in the lip of the sidewalls to secure. I luckily had bull-rings to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Fits Perfectly!!!
customer_reviews.text: This Three-Pocket Storage Net was purchased for our 2010 Toyota Sequoia. The net that came with the vehicle got misplaced, so instead of paying an arm and a leg for one from Toyota, I took a chance on this one. It fits perfectly with no modifications of any kind and attaches to small "molded knobs" on each side of the cargo area. The net appears to be made well; it is sturdy, not light and flimsy. It stretches to accommodate the width of the cargo area and the three pockets are really handy. Actually, it's better than the original one that came with the vehicle. As for the durability? Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: VickiTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Looks fine but doesn’t fit F150 without additional attachments to reach.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for the back of an F150 but it doesn’t reach all the way across the bed with purchasing special items to attach to the net so it would work.
customer_reviews.author: R. Reed

customer_reviews.title: JUST WHAT I WANTED
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this fits my very small Toyota Tacoma perfect. I read many reviews on many nets and this is the one I ordered. As my truck has a hook on each side, and I have a drill for two small holes it works perfect. I did not try the stick one things it came with, stick on things usually come off easy, unless I want to take them off, then they hold on forever. Anyway with four nylon ties, four steel clips my net can hold anything, and is easy to remove to haul whatever. Not sure how much weight it will actually hold but when I have it a while will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Lilia's CO2 sales

customer_reviews.title: ...too stinky..!
customer_reviews.text: This product smells like Oil...motor oil. I would not leave it in my car and then want to breath in the fumes off-gassed by this product. I thought netting would be more of a rope or polyester fabric type, not something that smells like it was made from recycled tire.
customer_reviews.author: CABeachGal M

customer_reviews.title: May or may not work on your car.  I got lucky and it worked out.
customer_reviews.text: Took a bit of working things out where it would attach in my Mazdaspeed 3, but once I got everything worked out it is very useful. Put 3 or 4 gallons of milk in the back along with other things in a hatchback and it does not tip over and spill milk all over your back hatch area.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Frimming

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy and cheaply made. I hooked it onto my trunk for a test run. Went on a grocery run. Unless you have something very heavy in the middle the things will still clank and ding around. I had some glass jars and was nervous as hell as I was driving home and heard all the clanking. Maybe good for things like soccer balls but not recommended for groceries.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bond

customer_reviews.title: Adhesive pads don't stick, drilling is the next option -- no thanks.
customer_reviews.text: The adhesive pads needed for installation didn't stick at all to the surfaces of my GMC Yukon, and the alternative installation method requires drilling holes into the vehicle interior. I'm not willing to do irreparable damage to my car for the sake of this netting. I returned it due to the poor quality of the parts (i.e., the lame adhesive pads). One could probably try a 3rd party adhesive, but I didn't want to destroy the product trying, and then not be able to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Z MacDouglas

customer_reviews.title: 3 pocket storage net
customer_reviews.text: Well, the net looks pretty nice, but the installation is horrible. The "stick on" tabs they give were applied EXACTLY as directed and then left to sit for two days in the heat so they would be solid. Could not even get the first loop on the tab before it flew off. In all 3 of them came off and I will have to screw them to the liner making a hole,in it that I did not want to make. Never even got to use the net one time and it sits in the garage till I can figure out another way. VERY disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: LCA

customer_reviews.title: Not for all pick ups.
customer_reviews.text: Sellers need to make a note that it does not fit the 2018 f150 sport. Would of returned it but it's not worth that trouble because it was so cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Hiba Mouhanna

customer_reviews.title: I have a 2015 Ford Escape and with the configuration ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2015 Ford Escape and with the configuration of the cargo compartment walls plus the fact that one has to screw into it, this won't work even though I put the car description in the search. It should have been stated that it wouldn't work with the factory installed hooks and altering the interior of the car was necessary. The instructions showing this were also in a sealed container one has to open to find this out.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Amarell

customer_reviews.title: Really effective trunk net
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 2008 Chrysler Sebring and it's the perfect solution to grocery mayhem. The size of this net is just right. If I only want to retain a few plastic grocery bags I simply place them between the net and the lip of the trunk. With a larger load, I also use the net compartments. No more groceries escaping their sacks and rolling around or sliding in the trunk. The Sebring already has two mount points (steel threaded posts with screw-on knobs) specifically intended for a cargo net. The only question I ask, is why did I wait so long to buy this??
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly in a Toyota Sequoia
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of having groceries roll around in the trunk for my SUV so purchased this to fix the problem. The Sequoia has 4 hooks in the trunk that are in perfect position for the 4 loops this item attached with. I deducted a star because one of the loops snapped as I was trying to attach it. Instead of returning the product, I just decided to knot the string so it would hold onto the hook. This minor inconvenience was disappointing but I am still happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Rawlins

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Seriously you can not beat this for the money. We have a Kia Sorento and brand new CX 5 so I bought two of these. The sorento already had hooks so I just attach it and I was done and it fits perfect. I didn't realize the cx 5 didn't have hooks ( go figure car that was almost 9k more didn't have hooks?!?!) I haven't gotten around to drilling to install the hooks but it won't be hard I'm just scared it might be to big for the mazda. So I might just send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, poor construction
customer_reviews.text: Netting Broke after only a few uses. It's been sitting crumpled up in the back of our SUV while I try to figure out how to repair it. It broke when I reached over it for groceries that wouldn't fit in it and the net snapped that easily.
customer_reviews.author: PotterCoastal

customer_reviews.title: deceptive photo
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect this cargo net to stay neat compartments for storage. Many reviews also mention that stick on hooks do not stay stuck. It's built from somewhat elastic cord. The cord is not cut to lengths needed but one length cord is bent this way and that to follow the compartment shape. Its general construction is, however, what I need, and its price is good for me. I can figure out a way to use it for my needs, but a person without some fabrication skills will find it disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: ventingisok

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This fit perfectly in the cargo area of a 2011 Mazda CX-9. No accessories [that came into the packet] were needed to mount the net. And it is such a convenience to have something like this in the back of a vehicle in keeping all your groceries / stuffs in place and not running all over the cargo space while you drive. whoever came up with the idea is a genius. Loving the product every time we go shopping or on a trip.
customer_reviews.author: Expatriot

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory for trunk organization.
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded my expectations! I use it to segregate cargo and keep things from sliding around in my SUV. The elastic isn't particularly strong, but the materials are pretty durable. It will keep a watermelon from rolling around, and keep grocery bags from self-unloading on the way home. Comes with mounting hooks and screws/anchors, basically the complete package.
customer_reviews.author: John Q Public

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: One of the 4 handle hoops failed. I can't mount it correct, and so doesn't work. There has to be something better out there. That is the experience I had
customer_reviews.author: murfz

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This would have cost double from the OEM. I have a Nissan Murano and no such product is offered specifically for this model. Others by the manufacturer are a lot more expensive and probably wouldn't fit any better. My only gripe is that it should have come with "s" hooks. I'm not interested at all in the provided mounts that require drilling into my vehicle or the essentially worthless stick-on mounts. I picked up a set of 4 "s" hooks for 99 cents at home depot. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: DKB

customer_reviews.title: ... in the back of our Tacoma and it works great. We bought additional clips to secure the bottom ...
customer_reviews.text: We put this net in the back of our Tacoma and it works great. We bought additional clips to secure the bottom as well, so it functions as a divider and not just a basket.
customer_reviews.author: Christoper Chadwick

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for Nissan Rogue 2013
customer_reviews.text: ordered for my Nissan Rogue 2013 - had no way of fitting. Tried to stick on with the sticker, but my trunk was too wide and the pressure from the straps snapped the sticky part off. I can't drill through the side panels because you'd have to take a large portion of the interior apart. I ended up throwing away. Probably a nice product if it fits your car - but you would want to find this out before hand or be prepared to send back.
customer_reviews.author: RayLaur

customer_reviews.title: Great Solution
customer_reviews.text: We live in the mountains and nothing is more frustrating than hearing items rolling around in the back of your car. This was the perfect solution. It holds the grocery bags or shopping bags in place. No more broken items or loose food rolling all over the truck.
customer_reviews.author: oceangirl

customer_reviews.title: Best suited to a full size SUV
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my new GMC Terrain. The net is about 50% too wide, so I had to devise using only 2 of the 3 compartments. It does not come with any hooks, so I bought some carbiner hooks. The net is constructed to be secured at four corners. My Terrain only had provisions for two. I would definately only recommend this net for owners of large SUV like a Chevy Suburban of Ford Expedition. Net is well constructed. Be ware that it is designed to be secured at 4 top corners not the typical top/bottom attachment on each end.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: purchased this with the intent of using the factor hooks in my Honda Element. When it arrived it wouldn't fit with the factor hooks like I thought so I decided to try the "wonderful" stick hooks they sent. Junk! Absolute Junk hooks! They wouldn't even stick (yes the car walls were cleaned before applying them). It does offer a method to drill the holes, but who wants to drill into their car?
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Power drill required
customer_reviews.text: Anchor knob pieces do not stick. They tend to get pulled off from the pulling of the netting. Customer service was very helpful and sent replacements.....but the same thing happened. If you do not plan to actually use a drill to install anchors, then think twice. For the three times I was able to use it, I loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't easily install.
customer_reviews.text: Box says easily installed in trunk or truck bed. My trunk sides are a felt surface over plastic, so holes would have to be drilled in the trunk sides for mounting the Anchor Points. The screws were supplied with a spring steel nut, but was unable to access the back of the mounting surface to install. The screws alone into the plastic would not have held. So I am looking for another way to complete the installation. Not easy as stated. It will be awhile before I am able to see how it works.
customer_reviews.author: Leon

customer_reviews.title: Solution to hauling stuff from the store in plastic bags!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for SUV-type vehicles that don't have anything to restrain the dopey plastic bags that Wal-Mart et al. have forced on us. If you are tired of dealing with having all of the items you collected on your shopping trip scattered all over the cargo area of your vehicle, get one of these. Based on my experience with other items of this type, I recommend that you install BOTH the adhesive and screw attachments, although the adhesive seems plenty strong.
customer_reviews.author: LCH

customer_reviews.title: Handy for trapping accumulated stuff
customer_reviews.text: It's a great storage bag for the uses for which it is intended. For my purposes (hanging off the transom in the cockpit of a sailboat) the mesh is a bit too large and small items which tend to float around causing mischief slip through. That is no complaint against the bag as it is exactly as described. It is well made and versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur David Digby

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful!
customer_reviews.text: This product is so helpful! If I have groceries or items that I don't want to roll around in the trunk while driving, I put them in here. And I also use one of the pockets for reusable grocery bags. Which is great, because I have so many of them, and it's nice not opening my trunk to a sea of reusable bags.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L

customer_reviews.title: Back storage net
customer_reviews.text: I really like this net when it comes to grocery shopping, I get tired of reaching in the back for items that have rolled out of their bags, this net is perfect for the grocery bags I can get 2 or 3 bags into each section. I would recommend this for anyone that has a big trunk or an SUV it saves you from getting in the back and finding something that you brought and rolled out of the bags.
customer_reviews.author: Kroger Gal

customer_reviews.title: hated it - completely useless unless you are willing to drill into your car
customer_reviews.text: The stickers included were a complete joke. Followed all directions but it didn't even stay up when completely empty for 24 hours. If you don't mind drilling into your vehicle to install, and your vehicle isn't very wide (even my little Escape - 2014 - was really too wide for it) then I'm sure it would work great. But if, like me, you were attracted by the stick-on option, forget it.
customer_reviews.author: Little Pickle

customer_reviews.title: helps me organize
customer_reviews.text: have enjoyed this product from day one. I have a Pontiac Vibe which has a large open area in the back like many vehicles these days. I used carabiner hooks to attach in the back to existing 4 metal brackets and works great. I collapse it down to only use 2 brackets when I don't need full space and it still holds things from rolling around (like the ever-present soccer ball!)
customer_reviews.author: JDDPTA

customer_reviews.title: Works great for 2009 Mazda CX-9
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. Hooks over the existing hooks in the back cargo area so we didn't have to install any hardware or stick anything on. Grocery bags (plastic and reusable) fit perfectly and keep everything from sliding. If I have more bags than will fit, I just put them in front to keep them from sliding all the way to the back (with the 3rd row down the cargo area is huge and a far reach towards the back). Very pleased with this purchase and couldn't beat the cost. Way better than anything I found on Mazda sites. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennylynn458

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because everything in my trunk was sliding around every time i turned a corner, it works great. My trunk has anchors loops in it already, so i just attached it with some S hooks instead of the hardware that it comes with. I really like that it has a flat bottom, as opposed to the hammock style ones, and the dividers keep everything neat. Very good buy, I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Elegant solution
customer_reviews.text: I bought this net because of the positive review from another 2011 RAV owner. There are plenty of hooks and rings in the cargo area, and all I needed were a few very short black bungee cords to make this very secure. To keep the stored bags from hooking onto the net when removed, I found some plastic storage bins exactly the size of the compartments. Now, if I use just one bin, the others stay put. Recommendation: Strong BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: good netting
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2013 Toy highlander and I was able to install the included anchors into the same locations where I had hooks in the stock highlander. Do not buy this product unless you have existing locations for the anchors or you are ready to drill into your vehicle and make your own locations. I hook both loops on each end to the same anchor.
customer_reviews.author: Shack

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad of a jury-rig
customer_reviews.text: Hooks don't stay on at all with the sticker backing, so you have to drill holes into the siding to permanently attach them. Since my XTerra has lots of places to tie things down, I rigged a system with bungie cords and slipped the netting loops onto that. Not too bad of a jury-rig, but wasn't really what I'd expected to do.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: The concept is great, but the hardware needs some work. The parts that came with it have no stickiness to them. I do not want to screw the pins into my van, so I am in search of some quality adhesive to try and attach the holders to my van. Also I have a problem finding a totally flat surface on the inside of the trunk to attach it to.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Bolanos

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough for a Silverado
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it would fit across the bed of my truck. While it does make the width the basket is really stretched and under a lot of tension. I'm not sure how long it will hold up. If you have a full size pickup I'd look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: S. Green

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, looks nice, requires installation
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2014 GMC terrain. I didnt realize the net itself does not have hooks on it, so you have to use the pads that come with the net, which means screwing the 4 pads into the side paneling of the car, or using the sticky tape on the back of the pads. I didnt want to drill or use the tape on my brand new car, so I ended up going with the GMC version of the net, which using the already existing latches in the cargo area.
customer_reviews.author: John DeGirolamo

customer_reviews.title: For the Trunk
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our Pathfinder. Fits across the back perfectly. Did not use the screw in attachment with the sticky hooks, as I did not want holes in the sides of my truck. Loops work fine with the hooks I already have in the back. Works well so far to hold our grocery bags from sliding around, which is what I bought it for. Was the best price I could find, and shipped fast.
customer_reviews.author: Wyllow

customer_reviews.title: Great Storage net
customer_reviews.text: The net is great, wish the hooks in my car were farther back, cuz its right at the end of the back so if you need to put things over the net, you have to reach over...but otherwise, its nice and sturdy and the compartments are large enough to put things in so they don't roll around
customer_reviews.author: Connie V.

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: It is a decent, very affordable storage net but!! i have not attached it in my car because i do not want to drill any holes in my vehicle's trunk. Due to my vehicles interior surface it is very difficult to attach the sticky pads anywhere because they just fall back off but i am planning on buying a stronger/tougher tape very soon! :)
customer_reviews.author: Shot Caller, Top Baller!

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for owners of pickups with covered beds.
customer_reviews.text: I have had two avalanches is the last 10 years and this little net is an essential. Ours holds mostly groceries and is set back about 18 inches from the end of the bed to be used as a barrier so groceries won't slide out of reach. I usually put a few items in the net to weigh it down and then have more room for reachable bags. Can't beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS! I recently went from a 4 door ...
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS! I recently went from a 4 door car to a 2 door truck and had issues with groceries rolling around in the bed on my way home. This has really changed the game for me!
customer_reviews.author: Sadie&Dove

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Really nice product. I haul bags of feed in the bed of the truck but when you put groceries in the bed they end up everywhere. Trying to put groceries in the back seat is really tough. This storage net doesn't hold a tremendous amount but it sure helps.
customer_reviews.author: Dano1988

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a pretty good alternative than spending $50 at the dealer, but I really wish it came with connectors at the bottom as well when using it as a "hammock" type net. I have it in a 2014 Ford fusion that already had hooks in the trunk. Its a little large but again for the money its an ok compromise.
customer_reviews.author: Frank H

customer_reviews.title: Love this storage net!
customer_reviews.text: My car already had hooks for the net and so this was super easy installation. The storage net is great quality and I love it! Keeps all my groceries and bags in one place when I drive. This is my first time having one in a car and I don't know how I survived without one before!
customer_reviews.author: retail_therapy

customer_reviews.title: Great for my needs
customer_reviews.text: This is handy for the trunk of my Camaro. I got so tired of everything sliding around in the trunk so this was a good fit and it offers big pockets for about anything that you need to transport from place to place. I would recommend this product for your average size trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Storage net
customer_reviews.text: I did not use the attachment tapes provided. I only had one hook on each side of my trunk, so I hooked both loops in one hook on each side and it works without any problems. Keeps groceries in place without any problems. I have a 2013 Cadillac cts coupe. The dealership only offered a flat mesh holder that cost $30. This is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Isaacd

customer_reviews.title: Fraud
customer_reviews.text: Not long enough to stretch across the bed of a normal Ram 1500. And they want $8 to return it. This is a fraudulent product.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Sharp

customer_reviews.title: A Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: This storage net was perfect for my vehicle. I bought an Infiniti QX50 and there is no OEM or aftermarket cargo net for this vehicle. After looking at several other styles and brands this one looked like it would fit the best and it does. For my application I didn't use the mounting hardware that came with it but used clips to attach the loops in the cargo net to the attachment points in my vehicle. It helps keep my grocery bags or other purchases from sliding around the storage area and spilling.
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Trinka

customer_reviews.title: bri-guy
customer_reviews.text: I love this net we have had it for a week and have used it every day. The nice thing is my mini van has the net hooks already stock, so I don't have to screw any hooks in. But if I didn't have any ,then I wouldn't have any problem doing the holes cause its a modification that is useful. I'm pretty harsh on reviews but I love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: It delivers !
customer_reviews.text: I no longer have to try to fish things out of the front end of the truckbed ! it is stronger than I expected. I would recommend this to those who, like me, are too short to reach over the side of the truck and have problems climbing up over the bumper to get the wayward groceries !
customer_reviews.author: montanawoman

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than thought
customer_reviews.text: Good "little" product. However it is smaller than it appears in the picture. When attached to the hooks for a net in the back of my SUV, it does not touch the bottom as shown. It hangs above and has small compartments. But it works well for smaller items you want to hang above larger items already loaded in the back.
customer_reviews.author: BGSmith

customer_reviews.title: Useful but stickers don't hold
customer_reviews.text: I like this net and use it a lot for holding my shopping and stopping it and other things sliding around. The included stickers didn't hold for long at all, but luckily my Forester has a couple of hooks that hold the net across the trunk and it opens up OK for loading bags even though two of the four corners are hanging loose.
customer_reviews.author: MADianne

customer_reviews.title: Great storage solution to keep trunk contents from shifting
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for someone, and this is exactly what they were looking for. Its very sturdy, and made very well. Only difficult thing is locating spots to mount the hooks that hold the net. Expect to drill and screw into metal as the double sided sticky tape will most definately not hold up very long under stress or automobile environments.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was very helpful. I had a hard time attaching though. You may need a kit to attach.
customer_reviews.author: J.B.G.

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: Very nice accessory for your car. Keep bags and packages from moving around.
customer_reviews.author: Tire man

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I don't like this product a little difficult to put in my car
customer_reviews.author: Gisella Baum

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for 2014 Ford Explorer!
customer_reviews.text: It did NOT work in any way for my 2014 Ford Escape- there was no place for S-hooks either. The sticky things did not want to stick at all! I did what was recommended and two out of four stuck for a day and then they too fell off! If you are willing to screw into the hard plastic of the car then maybe this will work for you. For me, it was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Crafty Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Hooks don't stay 'stuck'
customer_reviews.text: This is still going strong! Only 3 stars because the stick-on hooks wouldn't stay stuck in my car. I have to loop each side to one built-in hook, so it won't stay open like in the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Charpin

customer_reviews.title: Storage Net
customer_reviews.text: Bought storage net for my 2014 GMC Terrain. It fits & functions perfectly. However, needed to install knob/hooks on side panels to utilize net - no problem. The sticky tape on the base of the knob/hooks is not strong enough, so used screws that came with net.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy R.

customer_reviews.title: Worked well, but not weather proof
customer_reviews.text: I like this product, it's exactly what I wanted for my truck and fit perfectly. Worked great for about a year and then all the elastic stretched out and it doesn't keep it's form anymore. It still works ok but it's harder to put groceries in it now because you have to hold it up because it has no elasticity anymore. I'm sure it would be great for a cargo area or trunk, but it didn't quite live up to my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer haynes

customer_reviews.title: Highland 95013 review
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure that this is a wonderful product, it just doesn't meet my needs. I selected it after googling a storage net for my new SUV. There is no way to connect it without drilling holes and it isn't large enough to stretch from side to side in the cargo area. I have one of the smaller SUVs so I don't think it would work in any SUV.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hill Chastain

customer_reviews.title: perfect fit for a Mazda CX9
customer_reviews.text: Took me a while to find a review of this Storage Net that mentioned a CX9. I finally found one that said it fit the rear of a Mazda CX9 perfectly. He was right, it's as if it was made for it. We are very pleased with the quality, look, and fit of the net...and the price was very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Twain Mark

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit!
customer_reviews.text: This Highland 95013 Black Three-Pocket Storage Net fits perfect in my Toyota Matrix. My Matrix is equipped with 4 d-rings in the cargo area and I just had to purchase 4 carabineer clips to run through the net loops and attach to the d-rings. It works perfect for keeping groceries and loose items secure.
customer_reviews.author: gramma10x

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: I like the 3 compartment storage. Put in my Chevy Traverse. Didn't want to blow $50.00 for the one from the dealer. Very easy to install. Wish I did this a couple of years ago before I lost a 6 pack of beer and a jar of pickels (don't ask...) out of the back after I parked.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Top of mesh fits well on the top on my ...
customer_reviews.text: Top of mesh fits well on the top on my 2010 Acadia, but cant fit both lowere hooks onto the hooks so it flops around. Still holds everything in place without rolling around. Hard to fill when your hands are full because it is flopping around.
customer_reviews.author: Hetal Rana

customer_reviews.title: Pocket storage net
customer_reviews.text: The highland storage net fit perfectly behind the rear seat of our jeep wrangler and is made of good quality material! It holds a lot of stuff which comes in handy when traveling. I would recomend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: chugalug

customer_reviews.title: works great and durable keeps everything organized
customer_reviews.text: works great and durable keeps everything organized. I live in a very small space so I used this as a clothes hammock. wonderful and hold a lot of weight.
customer_reviews.author: bunny1208

customer_reviews.title: Adhesives don't work
customer_reviews.text: The adhesive strips provided with this product won't hold on a textured surface, which is what my Toyota Highlander has (as does most vehicles). If you're going to use this you will have to either screw them into you car's interior panels or use a much stronger glue you supply yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin & Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea
customer_reviews.text: I still need to install the Highland 3 pocket net. I will wait until it cools down outside and then decided where in my truck bed to install it.
customer_reviews.author: campingfriend

customer_reviews.title: Works great but you will have to mount it with hardware, adhesive didn't hold ( no surprise)
customer_reviews.text: Dont bother trying to install the loop holders with the adhesive...if it holds at first, it won't last long...just drill a hole and use the hardware included, just like the factory would. Works great that way and then the net is easily removable and reinstalled. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Hertzair

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I finally found a cargo net that fits my 2005 Vibe....the only thing I had to purchase separate were the carabiners to attach to the already existing hooks in my trunk. It is easy to put on and take off the hooks.
customer_reviews.author: geeb

customer_reviews.title: It's so so.
customer_reviews.text: We have this on our Equinox. It doesn't fit like it's supposed to and I'm not drilling holes into the sides of the trunk. However, I attached it to the back of the seat with some bungee cords and it's working well to hold a blanket, a quart of oil, and a pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Mama

customer_reviews.title: No spills
customer_reviews.text: I use this in the back of a pick up when we go grocery shopping. It is surprising how many bags fit in it. Nothing tipped over or slid to the front of the bed. Works 110%
customer_reviews.author: Popeye69

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for holding my grocery bags in the back of my SUV
customer_reviews.author: AC622

customer_reviews.title: It stretches it pretty tight in the back of the car
customer_reviews.text: It has three compartments to hold stuff. It stretches it pretty tight in the back of the car. I don't keep it up when it is not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffy

customer_reviews.title: Love the compartments
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in my 06 Mitsu Eclipse. I only used the two clips that were in my car. It expands to fit the grocery bags. When not in use it is just a line across the trunk- not a box shaped net. The compartments keep things in place nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo Starr

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: The stickum patches are useless holding the netting. To use effectively, holes have to be drilled, which I'm reluctant to do with a leased vehicle. Exchanged for hard sided folding container.
customer_reviews.author: Brand new day

customer_reviews.title: my new cargo net
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great cargo net. I have a 2003 Honda SUV and I bought one of these back when I bought my car new, in 2003. I just replaced it because the stretch was now wearing out. 8 years I had this cargo net, and I use it all the time. It is great for groceery shopping and it is great to help organize things when you travel. I just love mine.
customer_reviews.author: LMS

customer_reviews.title: It's exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: We have been searching for another 3 pocket web storage net, since the first one we purchased for our other SUV came from a store that no longer carries them. This is a great product to keep items from rolling around in the cargo area, especially when the seats are down and also to keep them from falling out when the lift gate is raised. Fast shipping and excellent wrapping as well.
customer_reviews.author: HarleyD

customer_reviews.title: Huge - probably fits only large SUV
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge. Unless you have a large SUV, this is not for you. I actually bought it for my sailboat, but it's way too large. Some day I may find a use for it.
customer_reviews.author: Fantomfears

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Got this for My Dad for His Ford Ranger fits great and very easy to install holds your cargo secure. The divided areas are nice to keep things from sliding around in the net. Seems very made out of quality materials. Should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This net has been wonderful. No more sliding items in the back of my Matrix! I have not needed the inclosed "buttons" to attach the net, as I already have D rings I can use with calapers. It seems to be well made and looks like it will last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: xeric mama

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 2012 Acura MDX
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical at first to try this off brand product. I have decided to take a chance. The installation is a breeze. Just installed it to the existing buttons. It seems to be holding pretty well. I would not suggest this for super heavy items which are prone to spilling. I am very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DUBLIN VENU

customer_reviews.title: Should have been thicker material
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good quality, although not as sturdy as I would have liked.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Helton

customer_reviews.title: Contained, constrained.
customer_reviews.text: I just don't want stuff rolling around in the back of the Grand Prix. The net strings up inside the trunk and I drop all the loose stuff into it: sun screen, bottle opener, the football, dunny paper, stuff you don't want inside the car. I even put the takeaway in it so I don't have to risk it falling over in the car. One of those cheap purchases that can save disasters on the carpet and manages crap.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Hagen

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2013 Focus ST and this net fits great. For the price I don't think you can beat it. I have not tried the included mounting parts because my car had 4 hooks factory installed that work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: fierce

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for use in the cargo area of my 2015 Jeep JKU. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Brandolino

product_meta.title: Highland (9501300) Black Three-Pocket Storage Net
product_meta.description: Highland Black Three-Pocket Storage Net is designed to safely secure cargo in car, van or SUV's. It feature three pockets which helps to organize or store groceries, gear, tools and other items. This storage net can be adjusted from 44 inch to 56 inch in width, with a 12 inch depth and 12 inch height.
feature_bullets: Net size is 44 inch to 56 inch wide and 14 inch deep for smaller items
Stretchable net to adjust to fit where needed
Adjust to fit most trunks, pickup truck beds or SUV rear cargo space

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars533 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
